result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant DeAndre A Morgan in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for DeAndre A Morgan. Kevin Clancy, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Samuel E. Simpson for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has discovery and an offer, requesting additional time to review with defendant. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant DeAndre A Morgan not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for DeAndre A Morgan.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received offer but not discovery and requested more time for review. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36; Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris to appear by ZOOM, all other parties are to appear IN PERSON. Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant DeAndre A Morgan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status of counsel hearing. Court find defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. The court appointed Atty. Thomas Harris, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered no recoupment from the defendant in regards to payment of the county for the representation due to indigency. Case adjourned to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant DeAndre A Morgan not in court, defendant in custody, appearance waived.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. SPD has not yet appointed counsel. Case is adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Travis Schwantes on behalf of Meera L Al-Henaey in court, defendant DeAndre A Morgan not in court, in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling conference.  Defense request an adjournment. For reasons presented to the Court. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered no contact with K.I.M, J.C.R and S.K.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.    If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. Court ordered 24 hour curfew.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.'
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathalyzer tests.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant DeAndre A Morgan in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant DeAndre A Morgan in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
